reviewText: Sadly, I've only had time to watch this video once, but I liked what I saw.  I am dealing with a very sick family member right now, and I think if I could squeeze out a few minutes, this video would help me now.  Alas, I'll have get back to it.....I liked the format and the ease of presentation.  I know I'll enjoy it when I get the chance.

Title: N/A

reviewText: "Gentle Tai Chi" is a wonderfully pleasant instructional video for Tai Chi novices. The instructor is an attractive, vivacious woman named Dagmar Munn. Amazon's web site lists Dian Ramirez as the demonstrator but she is not be found herein.There are 5 sensibly-paced sections to the CD: In order they are 1) a seated warm up/loosen up session; 2) a silent standing session; 3) the main class itself dramatizing the basic tai chi movements such as "stoking the fire", "rolling the ball", "flying", "rain falls down", "gathering", swimming", "pitching" and "polishing the table". These are followed by 4) a longer, faster-paced "routine" and 5) a seated instructional. This reviewer would have preferred that that section be longer. It is very compelling but too brief. This is the sole issue this observer can raise regarding GTC.The entire proceedings are filmed outdoors in a lush green environment. There is even a waterfall! The two helpers blend in nicely with Ms. Munn.  She herself embodies the very picture of perfect health and must be the most non-threatening person out there. She makes the viewers comfortable from the very outset. One wants to listen to her! "Gentle Tai Chi" rates 5 solid stars.  The purchase price is worth every penny.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD does what it says.  It goes through 12 basic Tai Chi steps, links them together, and takes plenty of time teaching you them.  If you already have a Tai Chi background then this is probably to low of a level for you. It works slowly and gently, but you can still feel like you accomplished something once it's done, and the best part is if you are injured/sick/disabled you can do all the moves seated!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very affordable and excellant way to get into learning tai chi.The instructor and her partners are very easy to follow and understand.The mood and music are good also and I really enjoy doing tai chi with this video.
summary: one of the better dvds for beginners
